title.narrative: F.a: Pis Taay Go – Peace Always

description.narrative: Despite the progress in Sierra Leone regarding the rule of law and stability, the country continues to face challenges which have previously been identified as drivers of conflicts such as poverty, corruption and marginalisation. The vulnerability related to land leasing and increasing disputes over use of natural resources exacerbate the sources of instability, predominantly at the local level, threatening communities’ access to food and income. Hence, there is need to ensure that conflicts can be effect ively dealt with at local and community level.The main objective of the project is to promote culture of peace by enhancing local capacities in relation to conflict management and conflict transformation. Through training of traditional and religious leade rs, women leaders and youth leaders in conflict management and human rights the mutual relationship between traditional and religious authorities and civil society’s relevant actors is fostered. This will positively influence conflict management within l ocal communities and help to tackling the weakened accountability of traditional authorities towards their constituencies. Expected results:Capacity of traditional and religious, women leaders and youth leaders in conflict management and human rights enhan ced, standardised systems and methods of conflict prevention and mediation developed; networks and cooperation between traditional leaders and Peace and Development Committees strengthened.Right-holders/beneficiaries:Rural poor, community leaders, and wome n leaders, religious leaders (pastors and imams), traditional leaders (chiefs and paramount chiefs)Implementing partner: Network Movement for Justice and Development (NMJD)
